result.execSummary:
The defendant Dijon A Long was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Improper Use Of Firearms Or Weapons. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Improper Use Of Firearms Or Weapons
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dijon A Long

records.addlTxt: CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on September 2nd, 2022

Defendant Dijon A Long in court.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defendant requests to appear pro se for the remainder of the case. Discussion held.
Indigency Hearing held. Court appoints an attorney. State informs the court of an offer to amend charge.

Pursuant to negotiations, and on motion of the County, Court amends charge to IMPROPER USE OF FIREARMS OR WEAPONS pursuant to County Ordinance 63.02.  
Defendant enters a no contest plea  to the amended charge. Court finds defendant guilty.
Court  ordered defendant pay a forfeiture of $100.00 inclusive of costs.  Payable by NOVEMBER 4TH, 2022 or civil judgment.  

Court vacates appointment of attorney.

Defendant Dijon A Long in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dijon A Long appeared by video means.
Case heard off the record due to court reporter availability.
Defendant would like to waive counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37 to conduct waiver of counsel when court reporter is present.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Status conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Dijon A Long in court without counsel.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not qualify for SPD counsel and could not obtain an attorney. Defendant wishes to proceed without counsel.  Upon questioning, the Court finds the defendant competent to proceed and knowingly and voluntarily waives right to counsel and allows defendant to proceed pro se.   Court ordered case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 37.   This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Dijon A Long in court without counsel.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dijon A Long appeared by video means. Defendant has not obtained counsel.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (5/19/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Dijon A Long in court.  Claire Louise Starling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant walked into court at 3:10 p.m. He was scheduled at 1:30 p.m. Entry for Warrant was done. Warrant was declined.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Dijon A Long
Current: 502 N 39th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216   (Effective: 05-17-2022)
Prior: 3644 North 15th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Dijon A Long not in court.  Claire Louise Starling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/17/2022@1:30pm
